title: [BUG] PyODAnnotator fit method only accepts pandas dataframes
body:
**Describe the bug**
PyODAnnotator fit method only accepts pandas dataframes and produces an error if an np.array. 
```
File ~/projects/time-series/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sktime/annotation/adapters/_pyod.py:58, in PyODAnnotator._fit(self, X, Y)
     39 def _fit(self, X, Y=None):
..
     58     X_np = X.to_numpy()
     60     if len(X_np.shape) == 1:
     61         X_np = X_np.reshape(-1, 1)

AttributeError: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute 'to_numpy'
```
**To Reproduce**
```
pyod_model = IForest()
pyod_sktime_annotator = PyODAnnotator(pyod_model, labels='score')
pyod_sktime_annotator.fit(NUMPY_ARRAY)
```

**Expected behavior**
fit() method should be able to accept both dataframes and numpy arrays since we don't always want to have our data in pandas. 

**Versions**
Version: 0.11.4

System:
    python: 3.8.8 (default, Apr 13 2021, 19:58:26)  [GCC 7.3.0]
executable: /home/brian/projects/time-series/bin/python3
   machine: Linux-5.13.0-7620-generic-x86_64-with-glibc2.10

Python dependencies:
          pip: 22.1.2
   setuptools: 49.2.1
      sklearn: 1.0.2
       sktime: 0.11.4
  statsmodels: 0.13.2
        numpy: 1.21.6
        scipy: 1.7.3
       pandas: 1.4.2
   matplotlib: 3.5.1
       joblib: 1.1.0
        numba: 0.55.1
     pmdarima: None
      tsfresh: None>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
